overview_summary: The neighboring landowners are primarily long-established local farm interests, not corporate developers. One major entity is Meinholz Farms Company LLC, linked to the Meinholz family’s multi-generational Blue Star Dairy (the area’s largest dairy operation) ([madisoncommons.org](https://madisoncommons.org/massive-solar-project-could-change-the-landscape-in-rural-dane-county/#:~:text=Blue%20Star%20Dairy%20Farms%20is,cows%20and%20for%20spreading%20manure)). This family holds extensive acreage and wields considerable influence in the community, and they have expressed reservations about projects that would remove productive farmland ([madisoncommons.org](https://madisoncommons.org/massive-solar-project-could-change-the-landscape-in-rural-dane-county/#:~:text=Blue%20Star%20Dairy%20Farms%20is,cows%20and%20for%20spreading%20manure)) ([madisoncommons.org](https://madisoncommons.org/massive-solar-project-could-change-the-landscape-in-rural-dane-county/#:~:text=One%20of%20the%20Meinholz%E2%80%99s%20biggest,carry%20on%20the%20family%20legacy)). The other parcels are held by personal trusts (Roger I. Kittleson Revocable Living Trust and the Kelley family trust), indicating individual farm families rather than outside investors. Their specific stances on new development are not publicly documented, but as older landowners they could be motivated by the financial security of leasing land, absent strong succession plans. No evidence of organized opposition groups or speculators was found among these neighbors; however, the Meinholz family’s prominence suggests they could galvanize local resistance if they view a development as threat to agricultural land.

neighbors.name: Meinholz Farms Company Llc
neighbors.claims: Meinholz Farms Company LLC is a Wisconsin farm holding company for the Meinholz family, a multi-generational dairy farming family in northern Dane County ([madisoncommons.org](https://madisoncommons.org/massive-solar-project-could-change-the-landscape-in-rural-dane-county/#:~:text=Blue%20Star%20Dairy%20Farms%20is,cows%20and%20for%20spreading%20manure)). The family’s Blue Star Dairy is the largest in the area (approximately 650 cows on 1,130 acres) and relies on leasing surrounding farmlands for feed crops and manure spreading ([madisoncommons.org](https://madisoncommons.org/massive-solar-project-could-change-the-landscape-in-rural-dane-county/#:~:text=Blue%20Star%20Dairy%20Farms%20is,cows%20and%20for%20spreading%20manure)) ([www.yaharapridefarms.org](https://www.yaharapridefarms.org/about-ypf/board-of-directors/art-meinholz/#:~:text=At%20Blue%20Star%20Dairy%20LLC,about%2060%20days%20before%20calving)). Members of the Meinholz family have publicly voiced concern about utility-scale solar development, arguing that losing prime farmland to a solar project would undermine their agricultural operations and legacy ([madisoncommons.org](https://madisoncommons.org/massive-solar-project-could-change-the-landscape-in-rural-dane-county/#:~:text=Blue%20Star%20Dairy%20Farms%20is,cows%20and%20for%20spreading%20manure)) ([madisoncommons.org](https://madisoncommons.org/massive-solar-project-could-change-the-landscape-in-rural-dane-county/#:~:text=One%20of%20the%20Meinholz%E2%80%99s%20biggest,carry%20on%20the%20family%20legacy)). In 2019, a related entity (Meinholz, LLC) pursued legal action against the Town of Springfield to establish the right to operate a quarry on its parcels, demonstrating the family’s willingness to engage in litigation over land-use decisions ([law.justia.com](https://law.justia.com/cases/wisconsin/court-of-appeals/2022/2021ap000346.html#:~:text=County%3A%20FRANK%20D,the%20board%20revisited%20the%20legal)). The Meinholz family is also civically active (e.g., serving on the Yahara Pride Farms board), underscoring their influence in local farming and conservation circles ([www.yaharapridefarms.org](https://www.yaharapridefarms.org/about-ypf/board-of-directors/art-meinholz/#:~:text=Art%20Meinholz)) ([www.yaharapridefarms.org](https://www.yaharapridefarms.org/about-ypf/board-of-directors/art-meinholz/#:~:text=At%20Blue%20Star%20Dairy%20LLC,about%2060%20days%20before%20calving)).
neighbors.influence_justification: Largest local dairy farm (650+ cows, 1,100+ acres); multi-generational family with deep roots; active in local farm leadership; demonstrated capacity to mobilize or litigate for land interests

approach_recommendations.engage: Engage the Meinholz family (e.g., Art or Sherri Meinholz) early and directly to address their farmland loss concerns. Emphasize project benefits to soil and community, and explore accommodations (e.g., grazing under panels or revenue-sharing) that respect their agricultural needs, given their ability to rally local opposition.

neighbors.name: Kittleson Rev Living Tr, Roger I
neighbors.influence_justification: Individual family trust with no public profile; community standing undetermined

neighbors.name: Kelley Tr
neighbors.influence_justification: Family trust holding farmland; specific influence or stance not publicly documented
